page.title: 18Halloughton
page.content: { Halloughton}is an old village.There has been a settlement there since {Saxon times.}Also since Saxon times the village has been{associated with{Southwell Minster.}The church at{Halloughton}was not built in Saxon times. It was rebuilt in 1879 by Ewan Christian. When the village had first been found there were only{six}to{twelve {houses}and not many people lived there. It is still a very small village. There are{three farms}in{Halloughton and{twenty-five houses.}The largest farm is called Manor Farm. There are no shops or pubs in{Halloughton}so it is a very quiet place to live.
